item.title: Here is the latest update on the severe weather potential to
item.description: Here is the latest update on the severe weather potential today. The Slight Risk (or level 2 out of 5) was expanded. The Marginal Risk (or level 1 out of 5) remains south of I-70. Severe storms are possible across the area today, mainly between 2pm and 10pm. The main hazard will be damaging wind, though isolated tornadoes and large hail will also be possible (especially in the Slight Risk area.) You can stay up to date on the latest weather information by visiting weather.gov/pbz.

item.description: Aug 6, 2024: Hot and dry today with chances for storms tonight. Watch for strong storms in northern WV. Showers and storms possible again Wednesday, with the greatest chances in the mountains and northern lowlands. Continuing to monitor TS Debby. No severe weather is expected. @NWSCharlestonWV weather.gov/rlx/briefing #WVwx
